verses.t: Now{G1161} when they had passed through{G1353} Amphipolis{G3588} and{G2532} Apollonia{G624}, they came{G2064} to{G1519} Thessalonica{G2332}, where{G3699} was{G2258} a synagogue{G3588} of the Jews{G2453}:

And{G1161} Paul{G3588}, as{G2596} his manner was{G1486}, went in{G1525} unto{G4314} them{G846}, and{G2532} three{G5140} sabbath days{G4521} reasoned{G1256} with them{G846} out of{G575} the scriptures{G3588},

Opening{G1272} and{G2532} alleging{G3908}, that{G3754} Christ{G3588} must needs{G1163} have suffered{G3958}, and{G2532} risen again{G450} from{G1537} the dead{G3498}; and{G2532} that{G3754} this{G3778} Jesus{G2424}, whom{G3739} I{G1473} preach{G2605} unto you{G5213}, is{G2076} Christ{G3588}.

And{G2532} some{G5100} of{G1537} them{G846} believed{G3982}, and{G2532} consorted{G4345} with Paul{G3588} and{G2532} Silas{G3588}; and{G5037} of the devout{G4576} Greeks{G1672} a great{G4183} multitude{G4128}, and{G5037} of the chief{G4413} women{G1135} not{G3756} a few{G3641}.

But{G1161} the Jews{G2453} which{G3588} believed not{G544}, moved with envy{G2206}, took unto them{G4355} certain{G5100} lewd{G4190} fellows{G435} of the baser sort{G60}, and{G2532} gathered a company{G3792}, and set all{G2350} the city{G3588} on an uproar{G2350}, and{G5037} assaulted{G2186} the house{G3588} of Jason{G2394}, and sought{G2212} to bring{G71} them{G846} out{G71} to{G1519} the people{G3588}.

And{G1161} when they found{G2147} them{G846} not{G3361}, they drew{G4951} Jason{G3588} and{G2532} certain{G5100} brethren{G80} unto{G1909} the rulers of the city{G3588}, crying{G994}, These{G3778} that{G3754} have turned{G387} the world{G3588} upside down{G387} are come{G3918} hither{G1759} also{G2532};

Whom{G3739} Jason{G2394} hath received{G5264}: and{G2532} these{G3778} all{G3956} do{G4238} contrary{G561} to the decrees{G3588} of CÃ¦sar{G2541}, saying{G3004} that there is{G1511} another{G2087} king{G935}, one Jesus{G2424}.
And{G1161} they troubled{G5015} the people{G3588} and{G2532} the rulers of the city{G3588}, when they heard{G191} these things{G5023}.
And{G2532} when they had taken{G2983} security{G2425} of{G3844} Jason{G3588}, and{G2532} of the other{G3062}, they let{G630} them{G846} go{G630}.

And{G1161} the brethren{G80} immediately{G2112} sent away{G1599} Paul{G3972} and{G2532} Silas{G3588} by{G1223} night{G3588} unto{G1519} Berea{G960}: who{G3748} coming{G3854} thither went{G549} into{G1519} the synagogue{G3588} of the Jews{G2453}.

These{G3778} were{G2258} more noble{G2104} than those{G3588} in{G1722} Thessalonica{G2332}, in that{G3748} they received{G1209} the word{G3588} with{G3326} all{G3956} readiness of mind{G4288}, and searched{G350} the scriptures{G3588} daily{G2250}, whether{G1487} those things{G5023} were{G2192} so{G3779}.
Therefore{G3767} many{G4183} of{G1537} them{G846} believed{G4100}; also{G2532} of honourable{G2158} women{G1135} which were{G3588} Greeks{G1674}, and{G2532} of men{G435}, not{G3756} a few{G3641}.

But{G1161} when{G5613} the Jews{G2453} of{G575} Thessalonica{G3588} had knowledge{G1097} that{G3754} the word{G3588} of God{G3588} was preached{G2605} of{G5259} Paul{G3588} at{G1722} Berea{G3588}, they came{G2064} thither also{G2546}, and{G2532} stirred up{G4531} the people{G3588}.

And{G1161} then{G5119} immediately{G2112} the brethren{G3588} sent away{G1821} Paul{G3588} to go{G4198} as it were{G5613} to{G1909} the sea{G3588}: but{G1161} Silas{G4609} and{G2532} Timotheus{G3588} abode{G5278} there{G1563} still{G5278}.

And{G1161} they{G3588} that conducted{G2525} Paul{G3588} brought{G71} him{G846} unto{G2193} Athens{G116}: and{G2532} receiving{G2983} a commandment{G1785} unto{G4314} Silas{G3588} and{G2532} Timotheus{G5095} for{G2443} to come{G2064} to{G4314} him{G846} with{G5613} all speed{G5033}, they departed{G1826}.

Now{G1161} while Paul{G3588} waited{G1551} for them{G846} at{G1722} Athens{G3588}, his{G846} spirit{G3588} was stirred{G3947} in{G1722} him{G846}, when{G5607} he saw{G2334}the city{G3588} wholly given to idolatry{G2712}.

Therefore{G3767} disputed he{G1256} in{G1722} the synagogue{G3588} with the Jews{G2453}, and{G2532} with the devout persons{G4576}, and{G2532} in{G1722} the market{G3588} daily{G2250} with{G4314} them that{G3588} met with him{G3909}.

Then{G1161} certain{G5100} philosophers{G5386} of the Epicureans{G3588}, and{G2532} of the Stoicks{G4770}, encountered{G4820} him{G846}. And{G2532} some{G5100} said{G3004}, What{G5101} will{G2309} this{G3778} babbler{G4691} say{G3004}? other some{G3588}, He seemeth{G1380} to be{G1511} a setter forth{G2604} of strange{G3581} gods{G1140}: because{G3754} he preached{G2097} unto them{G846} Jesus{G3588}, and{G2532} the resurrection{G3588}.

And{G5037} they took{G1949} him{G846}, and brought him{G71} unto{G1909} Areopagus{G3588}, saying{G3004}, May{G1410} we know{G1097} what{G5101} this{G3778} new{G2537} doctrine{G1322}, whereof{G5259} thou{G4675} speakest{G2980}, is?
For{G1063} thou bringest{G1533} certain{G5100} strange{G3579} things to{G1519} our{G2257} ears{G3588}: we would{G1014} know{G1097} therefore{G3767} what{G5101} these things{G5023} mean{G2309}.

(For{G1161} all{G3956} the Athenians{G117} and{G2532} strangers{G3581} which{G3588} were there{G1927} spent their time{G2119} in{G1519} nothing{G3762} else{G2087}, but either{G2228} to tell{G3004}, or{G2532} to hear{G191} some{G5100} new thing{G2537}.)

Then{G1161} Paul{G3588} stood{G2476} in{G1722} the midst{G3319} of Mars'{G3588} hill{G697}, and said{G5346}, Ye men{G435} of Athens{G117}, I perceive{G2334} that in{G2596} all things{G3956} ye{G5209} are{G5613} too superstitious{G1174}.

For{G1063} as I passed by{G1330}, and{G2532} beheld{G333} your{G5216} devotions{G3588}, I found{G2147} an altar{G1041} with{G1722} this{G3739} inscription{G1924}, TO THE UNKNOWN{G57} GOD{G2316}. Whom{G3739} therefore{G3767} ye ignorantly{G50} worship{G2151}, him{G5126} declare{G2605} I{G1473} unto you{G5213}.

God{G3588} that made{G4160} the world{G3588} and{G2532} all things{G3956} therein{G846}, seeing that he{G3778} is{G5225} Lord{G2962} of heaven{G3772} and{G2532} earth{G1093}, dwelleth{G2730} not{G3756} in{G1722} temples{G3485} made with hands{G5499};

Neither{G3761} is worshipped{G2323} with{G5259} men's{G444} hands{G5495}, as though he needed{G4326} any thing{G5100}, seeing he{G846} giveth{G1325} to all{G3956} life{G2222}, and{G2532} breath{G4157}, and{G2596} all things{G3956};

And{G5037} hath made{G4160} of{G1537} one{G1520} blood{G129} all{G3956} nations{G1484} of men{G444} for to dwell{G2730} on{G1909} all{G3956} the face{G3588} of the earth{G3588}, and hath determined{G3724} the times{G2540} before appointed{G4384}, and{G2532} the bounds{G3588} of their{G846} habitation{G3588};

That they should seek{G2212} the Lord{G3588}, if{G1487} haply{G1065} they might feel after{G5584} him{G846}, and{G2532} find{G2147} him{G846}, though{G2544} he be{G5225} not{G3756} far{G3112}from{G575} every{G1538} one{G1520} of us{G2257}:

For{G1063} in{G1722} him{G846} we live{G2198}, and{G2532} move{G2795}, and{G2532} have our being{G2070}; as{G5613} certain{G5100} also{G2532} of{G2596} your own{G5209} poets{G4163} have said{G2046}, For{G1063} we are{G2070} also{G2532} his offspring{G1085}.

Forasmuch then{G3767} as we are{G5225} the offspring{G1085} of God{G3588}, we ought{G3784} not{G3756} to think that{G3543} the Godhead{G2304} is{G1511} like unto{G3664} gold{G5557}, or{G2228} silver{G696}, or{G2228} stone{G3037}, graven{G5480} by art{G5078} and{G2532} man's{G444} device{G1761}.
And{G3767} the times{G5550} of this ignorance{G3588} God{G3588} winked at{G5237}; but{G3588} now{G3568} commandeth{G3853} all{G3956} men{G3588} every where{G3837} to repent{G3340}:

Because{G1360} he hath appointed{G2476} a day{G2250}, in{G1722} the which{G3739} he will{G3195} judge{G2919} the world{G3588} in{G1722} righteousness{G1343} by{G1722} that man{G435} whom{G3739} he hath ordained{G3724}; whereof he hath given{G3930} assurance{G4102} unto all{G3956} men, in that he hath raised{G450} him{G846} from{G1537} the dead{G3498}.

And{G1161} when they heard{G191} of the resurrection{G386} of the dead{G3498}, some{G3588} mocked{G5512}: and{G1161} others{G3588} said{G2036}, We will hear{G191} thee{G4675} again{G3825} of{G4012} this{G5127} matter.
So{G3779} Paul{G3588} departed{G1831} from{G1537} among{G3319} them{G846}.

Howbeit{G1161} certain{G5100} men{G435} clave{G2853} unto him{G846}, and believed{G4100}: among{G1722} the which{G3739} was Dionysius{G1354} the Areopagite{G3588}, and{G2532} a woman{G1135} named{G3686} Damaris{G1152}, and{G2532} others{G2087} with{G4862} them{G846}.
